thread.title: Headliners draw fans of all ages
thread.title_full: Headliners draw fans of all ages

title: Headliners draw fans of all ages
text:
Headliners draw fans of all ages 22nd Oct 2015 4:32 PM Subscribe Now 
FROM 1996 to 2002, Regurgitator was one of the hottest and craziest bands in Australia. 
The band had four top 10-selling albums at a time when a top 10 album meant upwards of 50,000 CDs instead of 2000 these days due to illegal downloads and the general collapse of the industry. 
They also won five Aria awards in 1997 including best album (Unit). 
So with Originals Music Festival only a few weeks away and the 'Gurge co-headlining with Sticky Fingers, it makes for an amazing situation. 
Sticky Fingers is easily one of the hottest bands in Australia right now and probably the craziest if they get on a roll. 
Many of the fanatical fans of Regurgitator back in the mid-to-late '90s would now be aged 40 to 45 and have teenage daughters and sons who are madly in love with Sticky Fingers. 
So it's going to be a case of who screams and rocks loudest: mum, dad or the kids. 
I think there will be some very special memories taken away from the Originals this year. 
So far, a little over 50% of the festival-goers have come from outside the Sunny Coast and a lot of the nearby accom has already sold out. 
It's also looking very likely that the Originals Festival will sell out for the second year in a row which will be a stunning result. 
Tickets are available at www.originalsmusicfestival.com 
Tonight The Floating Bridges and Matt Stillert will be lighting up the Solbar and on Saturday night, Brisbane reggae/roots specialist Kingfisha will be busting out its super-cool new single (Water Running) which highlights the silky-smooth vocals of frontman Anthony Forrest and the bass-heavy hooks the band has become renowned for. 
Sunny Coasters Bearfoot, who are starting to earn a solid reputation, will be lighting the fuse at the start of the night. 
There's some great acts coming up over the next month including legends You Am I, Mat McHugh and British India. 
Coming Up 
Tonight: The Floating Bridges + Matt Stillert (Solbar) 
October 24: Kingfisha + Bearfoot (Solbar) 
November 7: Originals Festival (Coolum) 
November 19: You Am I (Villa Noosa)
